title: Beacon chain unable to find peers
body:
Hello,

I have been running geth 1.10.20 before the merge, and everything was working fine. Merge happened so I had to update. What I did is first to update geth to 1.10.24, then to install prysm 3.1.1. I am starting everything according to documentation in https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/install/install-with-script but I am unable to make it work.

My folder structure is as follows:

```
/home/eth
    /.ethereum # data
    /node # geth
    /node_beacon # prysm
```

I whitelisted ports 12000 and 13000 as safe in firewall configuration and checked the access via MX Toolbox as described here https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/p2p-host-ip#configure-your-firewall - everything seems to work fine. The ports are discoverable.

I am running geth with following options:

```
/home/eth/node/build/bin/geth --cache=4096 --http --http.api eth,web3,net,engine,debug,personal --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.port 12001 --port 30303 --datadir=/home/eth/.ethereum --allow-insecure-unlock --rpc.allow-unprotected-txs --authrpc.jwtsecret /home/eth/node_beacon/jwt.hex
```

I am running prysm with following options:

```
/home/eth/node_beacon/prysm.sh beacon-chain --datadir=/home/eth/.ethereum --http-web3provider=http://127.0.0.1:12001 --rpc-host=0.0.0.0 --monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --jwt-secret=/home/eth/node_beacon/jwt.hex --accept-terms-of-use
```

What happens is that both servies start up and are running, but no synchronization is taking place.
My geth logs is showing me:

```
Sep 15 13:33:16 geth[15949]: WARN [09-15|13:33:16.799] Local chain is post-merge, waiting for beacon client sync switch-over...
Sep 15 13:33:17 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:17.047] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
Sep 15 13:33:18 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:18.163] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
Sep 15 13:33:19 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:19.240] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
Sep 15 13:33:19 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:19.524] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
Sep 15 13:33:20 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:20.580] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
Sep 15 13:33:21 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:21.074] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
Sep 15 13:33:27 geth[15949]: INFO [09-15|13:33:27.720] Legacy sync reached merge threshold      number=15,537,419 hash=78c1c2..58cd79 td=58,750,256,312,486,924,353,244 ttd=58,750,000,000,000,000,000,000
```

While my prysm is showing me:

```
Sep 15 13:35:12 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:12" level=info msg="Finished reading JWT secret from /home/eth/node_beacon/jwt.hex"
Sep 15 13:35:12 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:12" level=warning msg="Running on Ethereum Mainnet" prefix=flags
Sep 15 13:35:12 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:12" level=info msg="Checking DB" database-path="/home/eth/.ethereum/beaconchaindata" prefix=node
Sep 15 13:35:12 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:12" level=info msg="Opening Bolt DB at /home/eth/.ethereum/beaconchaindata/beaconchain.db" prefix=db
Sep 15 13:35:12 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:12" level=info msg="Deposit contract: 0x00000000219ab540356cbb839cbe05303d7705fa" prefix=node
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Running node with peer id of 16Uiu2HAm5vH3xda3p8W587MxLFQMopUY6ctjeg1KnKpxKUH9aDrP " prefix=p2p
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Waiting for state to be initialized" prefix=initial-sync
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="gRPC server listening on port" address="0.0.0.0:4000" prefix=rpc
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=warning msg="You are using an insecure gRPC server. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc" prefix=rpc
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Starting beacon node" prefix=node version="Prysm/v3.1.1/653ea3b030c3bb99aa3f3d95a8de9f4d6e147930. Built at: 2022-09-09 17:21:54+00:00"
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Blockchain data already exists in DB, initializing..." prefix=blockchain
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Starting API middleware" prefix=gateway
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=error msg="Could not connect to execution endpoint" error="403 Forbidden: signature is invalid
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: : 403 Forbidden: signature is invalid
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: " prefix=powchain
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Starting gRPC gateway" address="127.0.0.1:3500" prefix=gateway
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Starting initial chain sync..." prefix=initial-sync
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Started discovery v5" ENR="enr:-MK4QK7O1p1ZL5wUWr6R8vsiQ1WeSpBOabVM_vXnXP0iSI6ycTJ7ePyRsm_6uYB8F-5YjS1SDn9PDEPY4j5R7rcSFsyGAYNBXFLDh2F0dG5ldHOIAAAAAAAAAACEZXRoMpBKJsWLAgAAAP__________gmlkgnY0gmlwhDYmUCKJc2VjcDI1NmsxoQKb6MmrLT1KOi6CO3tFnTLhHJ1ZvkQHmCOyGf8k5H-dSIhzeW5jbmV0cwCDdGNwgjLIg3VkcIIu4A" prefix=p2p
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=info msg="Node started p2p server" multiAddr="/ip4/255.255.255.255/tcp/13000/p2p/16Uiu2HAm5vH3xda3p8W587MxLFQMopUY6ctjeg1KnKpxKUH9aDrP" prefix=p2p
Sep 15 13:35:18 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:18" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
Sep 15 13:35:23 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:23" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
```

And then it is basically stuck on repeating

```
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:13" level=error msg="Could not connect to execution endpoint" error="403 Forbidden: signature is invalid
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: : 403 Forbidden: signature is invalid
Sep 15 13:35:13 prysm.sh[23659]: " prefix=powchain
```

And

```
Sep 15 13:35:23 prysm.sh[23659]: time="2022-09-15 13:35:23" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
```

I tried to look on GH issues for that powchain issue but was unable to find any answer. I also did not find answer in documentation, but considering other prefiexes work I dont know why powchain prefix does not work or what should I do to fix the issue.

Ok, It seems I was able to fix the powchain prefix error. The documentation states that it is possible to generate JWT token using this instruction - which I previously used:

```
Use a utility like OpenSSL to create the token via command: openssl rand -hex 32 | tr -d "\n" > "jwt.hex".
```

But in my case (Ubuntu 18.04) it lead to creation of that "invalid signature" error when connecting to geth node. If I used the other solution of:

```
Use Prysm to generate the jwt.hex file:
```

Then it works correctly, I don't have a powchain error anymore and there are not any errors.

Unfortunately this did not help for syncing issue. My beacon is still unable to find anyone. I am stuck:

```
Sep 15 17:14:08 prysm.sh[16219]: time="2022-09-15 17:14:08" level=warning msg="Execution client is not syncing" prefix=powchain
Sep 15 17:14:09 prysm.sh[16219]: time="2022-09-15 17:14:09" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
Sep 15 17:14:14 prysm.sh[16219]: time="2022-09-15 17:14:14" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0
Sep 15 17:14:19 prysm.sh[16219]: time="2022-09-15 17:14:19" level=info msg="Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing" prefix=initial-sync required=3 suitable=0

```

Can anyone help with this? What am I doing wrong?

me too, I also encountered this problem. How to find the suitable peers? Please!!!
./prysm.sh beacon-chain --datadir /data/ethereum/.ethereum --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --jwt-secret=/data/ethereum/consensus/prysm/jwt.hex --suggested-fee-recipient=0xB16f3bCCc8375Eb0AF2a27d970DB42CB60725620

[2022-09-19 14:22:44]  INFO p2p: Peer summary activePeers=0 inbound=0 outbound=0
[2022-09-19 14:22:44]  INFO initial-sync: Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing required=3 suitable=0
[2022-09-19 14:22:48]  INFO powchain: Ready for The Merge latestDifficulty=17179869184 network=mainnet terminalDifficulty=58750000000000000000000
[2022-09-19 14:22:49]  INFO initial-sync: Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing required=3 suitable=0
[2022-09-19 14:22:54]  INFO initial-sync: Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing required=3 suitable=0
[2022-09-19 14:22:58]  INFO powchain: Ready for The Merge latestDifficulty=17179869184 network=mainnet terminalDifficulty=58750000000000000000000
[2022-09-19 14:22:59]  INFO initial-sync: Waiting for enough suitable peers before syncing required=3 suitable=0

Could you try turning the log verbosity higher? `--verbosity=debug`

Maybe there are some clues there, however I suspect the problem is a misconfiguration of the firewall or networking issues rather than a software issue.

I had this issue last night. I noticed that when I started geth, it was loading a jwt from /home/user/.ethereum/geth/jwtsecret which was different than the one I created and started geth with "--authrpc.jwtsecret=/home/user/prysm/jwt.hex." I recommend checking this when geth starts up and make sure it matches that of the beacon client.
Hey following up with this are you using vpn? perhaps it's related to this https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/11611 if not it is most likely a local config issue.
issue is stale closing for now.
